channel.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
channel.description:
![](upload://pWQrHm5pa2tPMIqtfF9MN3cr8Dr.jpeg)![](upload://azSCwQZWxoKvctuozlj1b0XFCIm.jpeg)![](upload://dnJgQiKCQDN1xB9JJvvuBuCyxoO.jpeg) [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=84NI5fjTfpQ']Youtube video: Introducing Windows 10 - the best Windows yet[/url] [quote] Microsoft is officially unveiling the name for the next release of Windows today: Windows 10. While the software maker had referred to Windows 9 as codename Windows Threshold internally, today’s official naming puts any rumors of Windows, Windows TH, Windows X, and Windows One to bed. It’s simply Windows 10, marking a jump from the mixed reception of Windows 8. [/quote] Another video is in the source: [url='https://www.theverge.com/2014/9/30/6868695/microsoft-windows-10-announced-official']https://www.theverge.com/2014/9/30/6868695/microsoft-windows-10-announced-official[/url]
edit: By the way here are some HQ pictures from the Windows blog: [url='https://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/09/30/announcing-windows-10/']https://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/09/30/announcing-windows-10/[/url]

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: BuzzKillington
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

Who needs a sense of humor when you have a picture of yourself to sleep with every night?

And his giant ego comes out… once again. That, or he fakes it. Likely because he actually has no self-esteem in real-life. Don’t worry - I also know…

[COLOR=‘black’] How he responds to my proposition of comfort will tell which one is actually true.

Read full topic

acade365:

Being a human; if you actually believe that he believes that… you should grow a sense of humor.

Who needs a sense of humor when you have a picture of yourself to sleep with every night?

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
But it opens the (metaphorical) window for actual malicious intent nonetheless.

That’s like leaving your front door open at all times because you might not mind if a friend or relative gets in to get a beer from your fridge.

You just can’t dismiss some measure of security.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Maxey:

Oh, then I guess it should be ok if I install cameras and microphones all over your house, specially in the bathrooms and sleeping rooms?

BuzzKillington:

So you want the entire world to know that you pick your nose? Scratch your balls and then smell your hand? How you take illicit drugs? Or perhaps how you masterbate to gay porn?

Yeah didn’t think so… :meh:

If the people violating my privacy are strangers and I don’t have a reason to believe they’re doing it maliciously I don’t care. I’m a little touchier if it’s people I know, but not too much so. So yeah, in both cases, as long as the violation was restricted to strangers I’d care very little. I mean I doubt I’d do it without getting paid for it, but you wouldn’t have to pay me all that much.

For example, one of my housemates keeps leaving the blinds and window open in our bathroom. There’s a large house with windows angled just such that anyone in the house can see you on the can if they care to look. At first I kept putting the blinds down, but after a little while I realized putting the blinds down every time the culprit leaves them up is more work than it’s worth. So now I shit shower and piss in relatively plain view to the house across the alley.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: BuzzKillington
item.description:
garrthbarrttinn:

…privacy is overrated.

So you want the entire world to know that you pick your nose? Scratch your balls and then smell your hand? How you take illicit drugs? Or perhaps how you masterbate to gay porn?

Yeah didn’t think so… :meh:

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Well they openly admit it in the EULA, but nobody reads it so just a heads up. I’m just repeating the advice from some of the smartest tech experts on the internet. They always advise not to use a beta OS without its own dedicated pc or virtual machine, with keylogger or without.

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Pyro:

Wait, you can download a beta now?

Yeah you can.

Anyway, who cares about a keylogger? Unless you have some particular reason to believe they’ll use it against you, privacy is overrated.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I think they care too much about the build number. It’s not like the new Source engine is officially called Source 5 (just because the build number is 5595)

Also apparently Windows 10 official beta has a keylogger inside, so unless you want microsoft recording your keystrokes, don’t run the beta as your daily driver just yet. Unless there is some keylogger removal tool online that works on windows 10.

Read full topic
item.source: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: BuzzKillington
item.description:
varg.666:

Yeah, apparently Microsoft can’t even count.

1
2
3
95
98
2000
7
8
10

Or maybe they’re trying to piss us off. But unfortunately they have failed miserably.

I can understand why someone with little develouper knowledge wouldn’t understand their reasoning for naming the next version of Windows, Windows 10. However, they named them after the build numbers. Not the release.

In actuality there’s 21 different official (meaning complete and released to market) consumer versions of Windows. Even more if you count the enterprise/server editions.

However, the name ‘Windows 10’ actually makes perfect sense. By that time, the build number for the Operating system will reach ‘Windows NT 6.5 Build 10000’ of course it will change over time. As every single hotfix, or tiny update changes the Windows build number.

Technically - Windows 8, should have been called ‘Windows 9’ because Windows 8’s original build number was ‘9200’. Windows 8.1 moved that up to ‘Build 9600’. That’s why inside Microsoft, they were trying to keep the build number under 9xxx, so it could remain true to the fact that this, was indeed, Windows Build #8. But they missed that target due to internal hotfixes before the official RTM release.

I remember downloading Windows 8 (two years ago now), right when it hit the ‘Gold Master’ mark. Someone leaked it on the internet, and I got it in early August. 3 months before it hit shelves. The build number for GM was, ironically, ‘Windows NT 6.4 Build 8888’ but when the RTM build hit the torrents in late September, it had been bumped up to ‘9200’.

Anyways, I hope you get my point. They are naming them after build numbers again - like they did back in Windows 3.1 days :rolleyes: . That’s why ‘Windows 7’ was called ‘Windows 7’. Because it’s build number was ‘Windows NT 6.3 Build 7100’

Read full topic
item.source: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that

item.title: Windows 9 is now named Windows 10 if you can believe that
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

Oh hey, Windows 10 has virtual desktops. Welcome to like 20 years ago, Windows.

Apparently the upgrade from Windows 8 to Windows 10 will also be free. Hopefully they extend the same offer to us Windows 7 folk.

Wait, really? That’s awesome.

Read full topic

And I’m getting pretty hyped for 10. I really hope M$ doesn’t fuck this up.
